title: Make Pending Friend Requests section visible in SkelMsg

requirements.text: Update MessagingPage component to ensure the FriendRequestsList component is properly rendered and visible in the SkelMsg interface, positioned above or alongside the conversation list in the main layout

quotes: yes, this option is not visible, add it in SkelMsg

acceptanceCriteria: FriendRequestsList component is visible when MessagingPage loads
Pending friend requests section appears prominently in the SkelMsg interface
The section displays incoming friend requests with accept/decline buttons
Layout accommodates the friend requests section without breaking existing conversation list or friends list

requirements.text: Verify that the useGetFriendRequests React Query hook is being called in MessagingPage and properly fetching pending friend requests from the backend

quotes: yes, this option is not visible, add it in SkelMsg

acceptanceCriteria: useGetFriendRequests hook is invoked in MessagingPage
Friend requests data is fetched and passed to FriendRequestsList component
Loading and error states are handled appropriately
Data refreshes automatically when friend requests change

requirements.text: Add visual styling to the Pending Friend Requests section to make it stand out with a clear heading, appropriate spacing, and consistent neon theme styling matching the rest of SkelMsg
acceptanceCriteria: Section has a clear 'Pending Friend Requests' heading
Styling matches the neon-inspired theme of SkelUlt
Appropriate spacing between friend request items
Visual hierarchy makes the section easy to identify and use

constraints: Do not modify backend friend request logic or data structures
Preserve existing FriendRequestsList component functionality with accept/decline buttons
Maintain the current MessagingPage tab structure and conversation list layout
Keep the neon-inspired design theme consistent
nonGoals: Changing the friend request backend API or data model
Adding new friend request features beyond visibility
Modifying the AddFriendsModal or FriendsList components
